description: The Vocabulary of Interlinked Datasets (VoID) is an RDF Schema vocabulary for expressing metadata about RDF datasets. It is intended as a bridge between the publishers and users of RDF data, with applications ranging from data discovery to cataloging and archiving of datasets. This document provides a formal definition of the new RDF classes and properties introduced for VoID.
label: Vocabulary of Interlinked Datasets (VoID)

Dataset.description: A set of RDF triples that are published, maintained or aggregated by a single provider.
Dataset.label: dataset

DatasetDescription.description: A web resource whose foaf:primaryTopic or foaf:topics include void:Datasets.
DatasetDescription.label: dataset description

Linkset.description: A collection of RDF links between two void:Datasets.
Linkset.label: linkset

TechnicalFeature.description: A technical feature of a void:Dataset, such as a supported RDF serialization format.
TechnicalFeature.label: technical feature

classPartition.description: A subset of a void:Dataset that contains only the entities of a certain rdfs:Class.
classPartition.label: class partition

dataDump.description: An RDF dump, partial or complete, of a void:Dataset.
dataDump.label: Data Dump

inDataset.description: Points to the void:Dataset that a document is a part of.
inDataset.label: in dataset

target.description: One of the two datasets linked by the Linkset.
target.label: Target

openSearchDescription.description: An OpenSearch description document for a free-text search service over a void:Dataset.
openSearchDescription.label: open search description

propertyPartition.description: A subset of a void:Dataset that contains only the triples of a certain rdf:Property.
propertyPartition.label: property partition

rootResource.description: A top concept or entry point for a void:Dataset that is structured in a tree-like fashion. All resources in a dataset can be reached by following links from its root resources in a small number of steps.
rootResource.label: root resource

uriLookupEndpoint.description: Defines a simple URI look-up protocol for accessing a dataset.
uriLookupEndpoint.label: has an URI look-up endpoint at

vocabulary.description: A vocabulary that is used in the dataset.
vocabulary.label: vocabulary

classes.description: The total number of distinct classes in a void:Dataset. In other words, the number of distinct resources occuring as objects of rdf:type triples in the dataset.
classes.label: classes

distinctObjects.description: The total number of distinct objects in a void:Dataset. In other words, the number of distinct resources that occur in the object position of triples in the dataset. Literals are included in this count.
distinctObjects.label: distinct objects

distinctSubjects.description: The total number of distinct subjects in a void:Dataset. In other words, the number of distinct resources that occur in the subject position of triples in the dataset.
distinctSubjects.label: distinct subjects

documents.description: The total number of documents, for datasets that are published as a set of individual documents, such as RDF/XML documents or RDFa-annotated web pages. Non-RDF documents, such as web pages in HTML or images, are usually not included in this count. This property is intended for datasets where the total number of triples or entities is hard to determine. void:triples or void:entities should be preferred where practical.
documents.label: number of documents

entities.description: The total number of entities that are described in a void:Dataset.
entities.label: number of entities

properties.description: The total number of distinct properties in a void:Dataset. In other words, the number of distinct resources that occur in the predicate position of triples in the dataset.
properties.label: number of properties

triples.description: The total number of triples contained in a void:Dataset.
triples.label: number of triples

uriSpace.description: A URI that is a common string prefix of all the entity URIs in a void:Dataset.
uriSpace.label: URI space
